bill.title: Criminal History Record Checks; Police; Permits to Acquire Firearms; Firearm Registration; Rap Back System
bill.description: Authorizes county police departments to enroll firearms permit applicants and individuals who are registering their firearms into a criminal record monitoring service used to alert police when an owner of a firearm is arrested for a criminal offense anywhere in the country. (SD2)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Introduced and Passed First Reading
Referred to PBS, JUD, referral sheet 5
Bill scheduled to be heard by PBS on Thursday, 02-11-16 10:00AM in House conference room 309.

The committees on PBS recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Takayama, Yamashita, Ichiyama, Johanson, Keohokalole, Nakashima, San Buenaventura, Takumi; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Har, Tupola; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Aquino.
Reported from PBS (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 301-16) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Fukumoto Chang, Har, Ito, Jordan, Kawakami, Matsumoto, Oshiro, Tokioka, Tupola, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott voting no (1) and none excused (0).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 03-01-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 12 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, C. Lee, Morikawa, Takayama, Woodson; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Kawakami, Thielen; 1 Noes: Representative(s) McDermott; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Nakashima.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 995-16) as amended in HD 2, recommending passage on Third Reading.
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-08-16.

Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Choy, Evans, Ito, Jordan, Keohokalole, Lowen, Oshiro, Pouha voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Aquino, Cullen, DeCoite, Fukumoto Chang, Har, Kawakami, Kong, Matsumoto, McDermott, McKelvey, Thielen, Tokioka, Tupola, Ward, Yamane voting no (15) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 340).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDL.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-15-16 1:20PM in conference room 229.
The committee(s) on PSM deferred the measure until 03-22-16 1:25PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in PSM were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Espero, Baker, Inouye; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3071) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 03-30-16 9:30AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, Kim, L. Thielen; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 2 No(es): Senator(s) Gabbard, Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) K.Kahele.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3487) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-12-16.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Wakai . Noes, 1 (Senator(s) Gabbard). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Slom). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 630) in amended form (SD 2).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 609).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Nishihara Chair; Keith-Agaran Co-Chair; Espero.
House Conferees Appointed: Takayama, Rhoads Co-Chairs; C. Lee.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 652).
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 611).
